quack.title: Todo
quack.heading: File format
quack.text: The on-disk format needs to be completed, and finalized as 1.0.

Once the format is finalized, we need to register a MIME type with GNOME via a .desktop file so that documents are launched when opened by the Nautilus file browser or with gnome-open from the command line.

This will probably also require single instance code via [org.gnome.notify] Notify. We'll need to have a mechanism to differentiate between development and normal use (start new instance & terminate existing vs just load into existing instance?).
Should individual chapters be launchable, or just the document?
quack.heading: Saving
quack.text: The line-breaking algorithm in Xom is rather poor: it takes the maximum line length specified, subtracts 10, and then looks for a possible line break after that point. This makes for erratic justification, trailing space characters, and other artifacts. This is due to Xom's Serializer handles its output one character at a time and has no look ahead / read back capability.
It may be better for us to write the output file to a StringWriter or ByteArrayOutputStream and then do the breaks manually by doing ' ' to '\n' replacements.

For what it's worth, though, it's getting closer to the point where not using Xom and just doing the really minimal XML work ourselves would be feasible. Not really that interested going down the not-invented-here road, but...
quack.heading: User interface
quack.text: While loading, display, rendering, and saving of documents with <note> and <cite> tags is implemented, there's no user interface for adding or creating these markers yet, nor editing the reference bodies.
While we have enabled adding words to the user's custom dictionary via "Add" in the suggestions menu, it may make sense to add words to the document. Perhaps this is just "Ignore"?
This will likely make more sense when we have a proper notion of document and can store a word list there.
